intro: Silene boryi subsp. penyalarensis, commonly known as the Penyalarensis campion, is a flowering plant native to the Iberian Peninsula. It belongs to the Caryophyllaceae family and is characterized by its simple, often hairy stems and small, pinkish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils, thriving in sunny, well-drained environments. Its flowers are usually arranged in racemes and bloom during the spring and early summer. Silene boryi subsp. penyalarensis is a relatively rare species, making it a subject of interest for botanists and conservationists.
